iq.js

Various helper functions, in the vein of jQuery.

Summary
iq.jsVarious helper functions, in the vein of jQuery.
Functions
iQReturns an iQClass object which represents an individual element or a group of elements.
iQClassThe actual class of iQ result objects, representing an individual element or a group of elements.
Functions
iQClassYou don’t call this directly; this is what’s called by iQ().
eachExecute a callback for every element in the matched set.
addClassAdds the given class(es) to the receiver.
removeClassRemoves the given class(es) from the receiver.
hasClassReturns true is the receiver has the given css class.
findSearches the receiver and its children, returning a new iQ object with elements that match the given selector.
removeRemoves the receiver from the DOM.
emptyRemoves all of the reciever’s children and HTML content from the DOM.
widthReturns the width of the receiver.
heightReturns the height of the receiver.
positionReturns an object with the receiver’s position in left and top properties.
boundsReturns a <Rect> with the receiver’s bounds.
dataPass in both key and value to attach some data to the receiver; pass in just key to retrieve it.
htmlGiven a value, sets the receiver’s innerHTML to it; otherwise returns what’s already there.
textGiven a value, sets the receiver’s textContent to it; otherwise returns what’s already there.
valGiven a value, sets the receiver’s value to it; otherwise returns what’s already there.
appendToAppends the receiver to the result of iQ(selector).
appendAppends the result of iQ(selector) to the receiver.
attrSets or gets an attribute on the element(s).
cssSets or gets CSS properties on the receiver.
animateUses CSS transitions to animate the element.
fadeOutAnimates the receiver to full transparency.
fadeInAnimates the receiver to full opacity.
hideHides the receiver.
showShows the receiver.
bindBinds the given function to the given event type.
oneBinds the given function to the given event type, but only for one call; automatically unbinds after the event fires once.
unbindUnbinds the given function from the given event type.

Functions

iQ

function iQ(selector,
context)

Returns an iQClass object which represents an individual element or a group of elements.  It works pretty much like jQuery(), with a few exceptions, most notably that you can’t use strings with complex html, just simple tags like ‘<div>’.

iQClass

The actual class of iQ result objects, representing an individual element or a group of elements.

Summary

removeClassRemoves the given class(es) from the receiver.

Functions

iQClass

let iQClass = function(selector,
context)

You don’t call this directly; this is what’s called by iQ().

each

each: function(callback)

Execute a callback for every element in the matched set.

addClass

addClass: function(value)

Adds the given class(es) to the receiver.

removeClass

removeClass: function(value)

Removes the given class(es) from the receiver.

hasClass

hasClass: function(singleClassName)

Returns true is the receiver has the given css class.

find

find: function(selector)

Searches the receiver and its children, returning a new iQ object with elements that match the given selector.

remove

remove: function()

Removes the receiver from the DOM.

empty

empty: function()

Removes all of the reciever’s children and HTML content from the DOM.

width

width: function()

Returns the width of the receiver.

height

height: function()

Returns the height of the receiver.

position

position: function()

Returns an object with the receiver’s position in left and top properties.

bounds

bounds: function()

Returns a <Rect> with the receiver’s bounds.

data

data: function(key,
value)

Pass in both key and value to attach some data to the receiver; pass in just key to retrieve it.

html

html: function(value)

Given a value, sets the receiver’s innerHTML to it; otherwise returns what’s already there.

text

text: function(value)

Given a value, sets the receiver’s textContent to it; otherwise returns what’s already there.

val

val: function(value)

Given a value, sets the receiver’s value to it; otherwise returns what’s already there.

appendTo

appendTo: function(selector)

Appends the receiver to the result of iQ(selector).

append

append: function(selector)

Appends the result of iQ(selector) to the receiver.

attr

attr: function(key,
value)

Sets or gets an attribute on the element(s).

css

css: function(a,
b)

Sets or gets CSS properties on the receiver.  When setting certain numerical properties, will automatically add “px”.  A property can be removed by setting it to null.

Possible call patterns

a: object, b: undefinedsets with properties from a
a: string, b: undefinedgets property specified by a
a: string, b: string/numbersets property specified by a to b

animate

animate: function(css,
options)

Uses CSS transitions to animate the element.

Parameters

cssan object map of the CSS properties to change
optionsan object with various properites (see below)

Possible “options” properties

durationhow long to animate, in milliseconds
easingeasing function to use.  Possibilities include “tabviewBounce”, “easeInQuad”.  Default is “ease”.
completefunction to call once the animation is done, takes nothing in, but “this” is set to the element that was animated.

fadeOut

fadeOut: function(callback)

Animates the receiver to full transparency.  Calls callback on completion.

fadeIn

fadeIn: function()

Animates the receiver to full opacity.

hide

hide: function()

Hides the receiver.

show

show: function()

Shows the receiver.

bind

bind: function(type,
func)

Binds the given function to the given event type.  Also wraps the function in a try/catch block that does a Utils.log on any errors.

one

one: function(type,
func)

Binds the given function to the given event type, but only for one call; automatically unbinds after the event fires once.

unbind

unbind: function(type,
func)

Unbinds the given function from the given event type.
